Absolutely loved this suit (I rented the jacket too). Beautiful fabric, well tailored details, flattering, comfortable, professional. The pants have a darker satin strip down the sides that adds a nice flattering touch. I wore this for my first day on a new job that is much more formal than my last job - I felt confident and put together all day.
The pants fit well - true to size. Really liked the subtle print.
Aside from the quality the fit was great. I dressed it up for event with pumps and shirt and dressed it down with hoodie and sneakers. Great suit I also rented the pants

I have a wider waist - this pant has no give so size up. I think I would have been ok up one size though the legs might be baggier. I'm sad about this as I love the fabric and style. I'll update this review if I'm able to size up and they look good.
I liked the pant, the fabric was a little itchy.

links_reviews_title: Great pants when paired with matching jacket!
links_reviews_text: Loved the look of the suit including the side stripes. Please note - pants are unlined and stretch out during the day to be about a size/two sizes bigger.
They were lighter weight then expected and not lined. Felt a little scratchy but not unwearable. Really liked the pattern.
There are great. The crosspatch pattern is fun and there is a tuxedo stripe on the side that gives it extra flair. Very dark navy, easy to pair with a lot of items.
Lovely dress, very flattering. Runs true to size.

links_reviews_title: Very comfortable with lots of room
links_reviews_text: Loved this dress. Work it to work with tights and flats. Wet flattering but I could have definitely sized down. Highly recommend if you love Kate Spade dresses!

this is v comfy with tights, easy to throw on for the office. however, it fits big pretty much everywhere. I wish the waist was a little tighter so it had more shape. plenty of space in the arms and across the chest. however, if I sized down I'd never be able to wear this without rights as it's quite short.
The dress fit great - not too short and comfortable room in the arms and hips. Fit the waist perfectly. Great for an afternoon wine tasting with friends.
Cute dress, better for shorter waisted ladies because it has a tendency to ride up a bit. Also a tad short for work. Still cute enough to wear twice!

This is my favorite RTR rental so far! I have worn it several times and am seriously considering keeping it! I always get a ton of compliments and it's very figure flattering. The material is lightweight and airy so the long sleeves are still comfortable in the warmer months. Could also be perfect paired with tights & boots in the fall.
Runs a little large. Cute. Easy to wear.
Love and very flattering! Work for a work dinner.

Super cute and comfortable dress! Made of a high-quality, breathable, and flattering fabric. The top is a bit low cut, so I wore a camisole underneath - however, you couldn't see it with the way the tie fell. Loved this and would definitely rent again.

This dress was a little more casual than I typically wear for work, but it was still appropriate for my business-dress office. I loved the little "Kate Spade" hidden in the scribbled pattern and the stretchy, forgiving fabric.

links_reviews_title: Super comfy but lots of fabric
links_reviews_text: I *liked* this dress, but didn't love it. Pros, great length and super comfy and different. Cons, lots of fabric and my husband thought it looks way too bulky. I didn't find it unflattering, but agree it could have had less volume of material and been more sleek.

links_reviews_title: Lovely pattern and super comfortable but not flattering cut.
links_reviews_text: I absolutely loved the pattern and quality of fabric. Very comfortable as everyday dress in spring time. My challenge was the cut. High waist made me even bigger than I am normally and gave no definition. I looked like I was back in 6 months pregnant. That being said, elastic waist made it very comfortable and probably works great as sophisticated maternity wear. I wore it to work as tunic with leggings as the length was a bit too short as a dress (and even more emphasized the maternity look), and this coming from 5'3. Because of its comfort, I still wore it a few times.

Will definitely size down next time, it's very pretty. Sleeves and waist (elastic) were way too big on me (felt that it gave me a pregnant look on the side and I'm not pregnant ha!) but the print is gorgeous and the material is very comfy. Basic work dress!
A great, comfortable dress. Received abundant compliments. Got the job done
I wore this to work and got a bunch of complements! It was super cute and still work appropriate. I loved the fit and how it flowed and the fabric fell. Great quality!
Beautiful, light and stylish dress. Great for work or to go out.
Loved the graphic script with "Kate spade" hidden in the print. Fit a bit hippy with the electric waist, but overall I liked this a lot.

I love the fit and style of this dress. It was conservative enough for work but fun for a night out. I wore once alone and another time with a jean jacket to dress down a little. Worked great at the waist and the length was perfect.

links_reviews_title: First time in a Kate Spade dress!
links_reviews_text: Very comfortable.

It really hurts to send this one back! Super easy to wear and great for the office and your evening out afterwards. Tons of compliments. Waist hit me a little higher than natural waist, but wasn't a big issue since I'm only 5'3". Like all Kate Spade, runs a little big, so if you're unsure on sizing, go down.

Pros: very comfortable pretty design and thin flowy fabric, perfect for cool spring/warm winter day. Elastic waistband with plenty of stretch. I'm very curvy and the large was perfect. Subtle "Kate Spade" written in the design, I thought was cute. Cons: band was right under my chest so I had to hold my posture to not look pregnant, not necessarily a fault of the dress but should be noted of your tummy is a trouble spot. Just a touch shorter than I would have liked so I wore tights. Im 5'8".

I really liked the writing/drawing pattern and that it looked nice with leggings. Very comfortable! The "Kate Spade" writing in the pattern was unexpected though, as I don't like wearing an overt brand.

This dress ran a little short in the waist for me (granted I'm 5'll) but overall was a great work week staple. I added a belt, black tights and over the knee boots and it was very comfortable for a full office day. I would suggest sizing down one size unless you are busty.
No where to go so this did not get utilized but I will rent again. Another classic Kate Spade fit.

links_reviews_title: Great dress that goes from day to night
links_reviews_text: This is the second time I rented this dress. The dress runs a little large compared to others from this brand. RTR suggested XXL originally, but that was way too big. XL still a little big. I probably could have rented L for more form fitting look. This is one that I will rent again and look to buy when it goes on sale. Great look for day or night! I wore to work and a happy hour after; compliments all day!
Not too short
very bold pattern, looks more black and white in real life (more gray in the photo). I wore it a few times to work over the past few weeks - it's very comfortable and looked great.
Great fit. The waist is a bit high and looked better with a jacket. Love the print!

links_reviews_title: Cute dress, perfect for multiple seasons!
links_reviews_text: I paired with tights and boots for work but needed to add a belt to add some shape to it. It runs a bit large! Print and fabric are both beautiful!

links_reviews_title: Love this outfit! Great work dress
links_reviews_text: Great dress!
This was sooo cute and fit so well! I almost bought it. It was comfy, but I got compliments all day. Even wore it for drinks after work. True to size!
Great dress, fit well and true to size. Wore to work and really enjoyed it!
Felt it was a bit short waisted.
This dress is incredibly comfortable but runs VERY large. Thank goodness the print sort of hid that it swallowed me up an I wore it anyways. Will definitely rent again in a size down!
This is a really cute dress, but wasn't as flattering on me as it is on other reviewers photos. I might try a size down.
Wore twice - loved the fit and print! Fun but still professional. Wore once with flats and once with tights and boots. Felt true to size.
a little bit short for work but okay
Easy to wear dress for work!

links_reviews_title: Great work dress - not too formal, a good length, fun. Comfortable for an active job too (I teach).
links_reviews_text: Fit is great; very forgiving and comfortable; could work for hot weather (in and out of A/C) or cold weather with tights and boots.
I really liked the print of this dress. I didn't find it very flattering on although I probably should have also been in a size smaller.
Soft and silky, with cute neon details. Looks best tucked into pants.
I didn't see the lime green stitching when I saw it online. It was a great unexpected surprise. It's boxy, but I'm into that bowler shirt style. Lot of compliments. I would rent it again.
Would have kept this for weeks but the 2 was unavailable and the 4 was just too big. The shirt is boxy as is and I made it work but I'd wear the 2 all the time
Boxy fit and neon detail made this edgier than other leopard prints. Wore with a black denim skirt and also with black distressed denim. Size 6 was true to size.
This shirt runs big and is boxy but I like the look of it for a casual day! Definitely size DOWN! I got a 4 and it's perfectly oversized... I usually wear a 6.
I love pretty much everything SL does and this one is no exception. Nice light weight material. Fit is meant to be large/boxy.

I work in a relatively flexible and creative environment. I felt funky, expressive and fabulous with this blouse tucked into high-rise jeans. Lime green stitching elevated the look even more. Instagrammed my look for the first time ever @niakingsley (I'm a super Luddite) and it was so fun!!
Love the print. Versatile fit, keep undone, tied, or tucked in. My first order and favorite piece.

I know this shirt is meant to be over-sized with its boxy cut, but a size 6 was literally two sizes too big. I tried styling it several different ways. Tucked in the material gathered and hunched. Tucked out (which is what I think was intended), it looked lovely like I was wearing a leopard bed sheet. Too bad. The pattern is cute and green piping is a really nice detail. I would definitely rent this again...in a size 2 which is a bit nutty with my 38" chest.
The neon stitching down the front is a fun detail to a basic leopard print top. Silky material and fit tts.

links_reviews_title: Chic and casual way to add leopard print to any look
links_reviews_text: Loved this top so much. Great look.
I loved this shirt, it went really well with black skinny jeans. It was perfect for work.
Really loved this one and wanted to buy. My favorite part was the lime green stitching. Cute and casual shirt that can pair with a lot of different bottoms.

links_reviews_title: A hip top to wear many ways
links_reviews_text: I love this top! It's a really cool and unique pattern and the fit is slightly loose which allows you various ways to wear it. I tucked it in to some tighter high waisted pants, as well as wore it out and loose. It's just a great basic top to wear over and over again
Wore it tucked in to high waster black jeans and loved it. The neon green stitching was a cool way to spice the animal print trend up

links_reviews_title: It looks a bit like a bowling shirt.
links_reviews_text: Loved the feel and the pattern, but the green stitching on the front makes it look a bit like a bowling shirt. Not quite the look I was going for.

links_reviews_title: Neon stitching was more of a statement than I expected.
links_reviews_text: Cute shirt for layering. Did not love neon stitching. Fabric did not breath well

links_reviews_title: Loved the fabric, the cut, not so much
links_reviews_text: I loved the fabric of this shirt but I would've loved it so much more with long sleeves. The short sleeves felt sort of masculine and I felt like I was wearing a men's bowling shirt. It "fit" I just didn't like the cut/style.
So comfortable & looks expensive. The print is a great color and lime thread contrast is a beautiful detail
a little boxy
Favorite thing I've ever rented. Just a super cute, silk like shirt.

links_reviews_title: So pretty! Perfect for work, a party, or night out!
links_reviews_text: A little big, bit overall true to size, great fit.

OBSESSED! I wish this wasn't so $$$ (especially considering it's polyester) or else I would definitely add it to my wardrobe. Take your normal sized --it's meant to be oversized. Super cute french-tucked into highwaist shorts or with black skinny jeans. The mint green detail and animal print are more pronounced IRL (photo almost doesn't do it justice!). A great rental!

links_reviews_title: Great summer top! Size 1 or 2 sizes down.
links_reviews_text: Great summer top for the hot days: super light weight, does not wrinkle, easy to hand wash and dries super fast. Size 1 or 2 sizes down. It's boxy.
Amazing shirt great with jeans or black pants. Good for work or post work.
I couldn't tell from the photo but this has really bright neon grim trim all over. That plus leopard print was too crazy for my taste. Didn't wear.

This shirt runs a little boxy, which is exactly what I wanted for a comfy casual workday. It's a little cropped (and I sized down) so it perfectly pairs with high waisted jeans and sneakers. I finished it off with a french tuck.

loveeee love love this shirt. I got so many compliments. It has a little bright green stitching detail that i didn't notice when i ordered, but it's adorable. perfect with a front tuck and your fav pair of jeans.

links_reviews_title: One of my favorite rentals ever
links_reviews_text: This blouse is amazing. I wore it so many different ways between black jeans and a couple of different skirts I have. The green stitching makes it so special. I would have bought this.

I wore this for an interview with dark denim skinny jeans, a black leather jacket and black Doc Marten style boots. It was really cool and had lime green stitching on the chest. It had a 90s vibe and a loose fit. I tucked it into the jeans. Lightweight and breezy fabric. I would size down if you want a more fitted look. Overall, would rent again- loved it.

Wore this out to lunch on the Lower East Side and ended up keeping it on through a birthday dinner in Williamsburg and into the night. It's got the perfect boxy shape to it, although I would size down next time - didn't look *bad,* just could have been a bit better. The fluoro seam detail is a fun touch. I also think it's great that RTR is supporting/carrying more interesting contemporary designers (like Sandy Liang) now.
Relaxed and fun. Definitely fits loose. You can see the neon green thread well, but it gives it s little more personality! Wore with black skinnies and some sport sandals.
I used this shirt with black high rise shorts. The material should not be used in hot weather as it does not play well with the sun! Everyone complimented my shirt and asked where I got it from!
Solid basic just a bit short.

links_reviews_title: Oversized fit, cute green stitching down the front - only obvious if someone is paying attention
links_reviews_text: Fit was loose so it didn't pull at bust like most button ups. Looked good tucked in with black skinny jeans.
With an elastic waist on the back these pants are chic and sooooo comfortable. I plan on buying these later!

At 5'10, my rise (the point between my Hooha and my waist is 2 1/2 inches longer than the longest rise anyone sells commercially (12" for highest rise - I'm 14 1/2). For this reason it's virtually impossible for me to buy pants. I have to have my pants custom made and it's a pain and it's expensive. These fit like a glove. It's true I'm wearing them as clam diggers because there's just no way I could wear them at my waist and have them be long enough. Even though they're supposed to be a little short, they go awkward short if I wear them with leg down. But they are super cute. Comfy. Flattering. That said-- since they fit me, they won't likely fit a single other body.
Simple but well made and can be dressed up or down. I wore it to a concert to a fancy dinner and work!
A little large. Might rent a size down next time.

Pros: more tailored than I had expected (high-waisted with zipper and button and a flat front, and elastic waist only around the back, comfortable. Cons: kind of a boring basic, looked cute with a blazer but nothing special Fit: true to size in the waist, ample space in the hip/thigh (I usually wear a 4 in pants if they are fitted but these were plenty big in a 2). The length worked ok on me but was close to being too long and thus saggy or too genie-shaped in the lower leg (a risk for anyone shorter).
I usually wear 8 and I got a 6 for this pair , and I still end up with extra room. Good quality material.
Fit is a bit loose but it's supposed to be, I'd imagine. A little more of a bell shape at the elastic than you can see here. More like how it is in the rtr photo

These are the very best pants. Super comfortable yet classic enough for the office. Fit was great, roomy but sleek. I wore them all day for two days and absolutely loved them. Will totally rent again.

links_reviews_title: Great casual or work pants, very comfortable and versatile.
links_reviews_text: Loose fit, great length. Worked equally well as a weekend look with birkenstocks and a t-shirt or with heels a blazer for work. Almost bought these, but looking to lose some weight and didn't want to commit to the size :D.

links_reviews_title: Kind of meh, not really my style
links_reviews_text: Not super flattering fit, definitely can make you look boxy if you have curvier hips, and my legs are super long so the pants sit at a length that makes me think they're a little short

Nice material, very comfortable black pants. High-waisted with button, clasp and zipper. Bottoms are cinched and look sorta elf-like if you have shorter legs. Hard to style with, but good for a trendier workplace setting.

links_reviews_title: Too Big and baggy on me but cool pants
links_reviews_text: Way too big and baggy. I was swimming in them. And the butt looked weird on me. Liked enough to rent a smaller size tho, however wasn't a huge fan of how those looked on me either. Don't think they're made for my body type but someone's gonna look super hip and cool in them!!

These probably look super cute on a very skinny woman with no leg muscle. Legs were a little too tight on my thighs, making it uncomfortable and throwing off the fit in general. Wasn't able to wear and returned.

links_reviews_title: Didn’t wear — not meant for tall people!
links_reviews_text: These are cute, if plain, but way too short for me (5’10”).
Nothing outstanding, but a nice staple piece that is made well and fits well.

links_reviews_title: These are the perfect dressy joggers you can dress them up or down!
links_reviews_text: The fit is true to size maybe a smidge large. Very flattering.

The pants were not a good fit for me so I didn't wear them. They ran large in the waist and didn't look cute like the photo. Plus, I do not like crepe and must not have seen that's what they were made of.
These pants are just weird; very low crotch and high waist made it look terrible on my petite and curvy figure. I would pass on this one unless you are really tall.

links_reviews_title: Not sure this was the look I was going for.
links_reviews_text: Not the best fit for fuller figure around midsection.
Super comfortable and professional. Paired it with a black blazer for important meetings

links_reviews_title: I'm an hourglass. Not a good fit for my body type. They puffed out around the top and hips.
links_reviews_text: Great quality. I would have loved for them to fit. But not good for hourglass bottom heavy small frame.

links_reviews_title: The fit was really modern and sleek. I felt trendy.
links_reviews_text: I like the fabric and lining and the fit was really comfortable. I received a ton of compliments.

links_reviews_title: Really comfortable - easy to dress up or down
links_reviews_text: Super cool, easy to wear
Very comfy, a bit big though. Can wear casually or dress up
Possibly, if you're really tall these might work. I'm not. So the crouch was to my mid-thigh and I was 2 Legit 2 Quit. Didn't wear.
Big in the waist but otherwise looked fine. Just looking for something better than "fine" so I returned them.

links_reviews_title: These are cute! I'm tall - 5'7 and these were short on me.
links_reviews_text: Not a great fit for ladies with small hips - the pockets puff out and make your hips look large.

Oh boy, these pants....I wanted to like them. I really enjoy something different than jeans or slacks. But these were oversized and not flattering! High waist was weird. I didn't even like with a crop top. Never even wore them out because they made look so bad.
I rented these for work and this style is great and comfortable but the fit was a little off for me. Too loose in the waist and just a hair too short in the leg. Near the hips they fan out oddly.

I got these for vacation - in my opinion, the fabric makes them acceptable for work only. The jogger fit does make them more casual, but they weren't a material I would want to hang out in on the weekend. The hips/thigh ran small for me (I definitely have thicker hips/thighs though), so I couldn't wear these unfortunately.
Cute - work or casual. Definitely run large, I'm usually a 2-4 and the 0 fit well
Maybe a skosh bigger than a 4, definitely some room in the legs (I don't skip leg day, so they were great for me). Very comfortable, nice fabric formal enough for office wear.
fine, was tighter around bottom of butt/goin area and loose on waist.

links_reviews_title: Waist was a little higher than I expected and it was not flattering for my body type.
links_reviews_text: Waist was a little higher than I expected and it was not flattering for my body type.
A little long nicely made!

links_reviews_title: LOVED THESE! Was able to wear them to work, to brunch and going out.
links_reviews_text: Fit really nicely around waist and length was good
Felt big and baggy on my 5"1 frame. I didnt wear.
It was too long in stride and big in waist.
I liked the silhouette of the pants, but they were too big on me. Since I ordered the smallest size, I didn't have a chance to wear them.
Crepe like fabric, was just a little loose which I liked easy to wear/easy to pack.

links_reviews_title: Sleeves are a bit too long.
links_reviews_text: Torso was perfect. The quality of the material was excellent. The sleeves too long, unable to roll up.

Wore this for family photos. It was oversized and comfy which was the look I was going for, but the sleeves were very long (I had to roll them up twice). It also wasn't as soft as I expected (but not too scratchy) but that's just based on what I anticipated from the picture. It served its purpose.
Sweater was itchy and a bit over worn. It looked cute coming off the shoulder a little, but there's definitely a design flaw because both sleeves were insanely long.

links_reviews_title: I loved the baggy oversized design of this sweater and just wearing it everyday with jeans
links_reviews_text: Oversized which I loved! Didn’t love how long the sleeves were or the color. But overall it’s very cute!
Nice with a long and narrow skirt, it's oversized but in a nice, elegant knit.
This sweater is gorgeous but too oversized for me, I felt like I was swimming in it
Nice sweater but runs large.
itchy and really bulky

Sweater runs big, I bought a size up due to liking my sweaters a little big, but I could have gone down 2-3 sizes. Sleeves are very long and wide. The sweater is adorable but would be a pain to wear all day. The sweater is very heavy and unless it's freezing you will be sweating all day if you wear it.
Size down. Very wide

links_reviews_title: Very cool sweater. It's very slouchy and quite heavy, but I love that about it.
links_reviews_text: This is a beautiful beige sweater just perfect for sitting outside by a fire. As did others, I found the sleeves REALLY long and rolled them several times to make cuffs.
A bit boxier than I expected, but otherwise a versatile, if boxy, sweater. Color was more cream than I expected, but still a good piece.
Cute but too itchy
The sleeves were overwhelming but I loved the fit of the bodice. I wore it twice - both just in casual settings. But the sleeves got dirty because they were so huge!

links_reviews_title: Wore this to work and to a birthday party.
links_reviews_text: Sleeves are huge, but loved the color and the cut.
Great oversized basic sweater

links_reviews_title: Very bulky and huge on my 5 foot two frame.
links_reviews_text: Size small seems like an extra extra large

links_reviews_title: The sweater runs very large. Fit great in the chest, but arms were too long.
links_reviews_text: The arms on this sweater are unreasonable long. The fit through the chest was great, but sleeves went down to my knees.

links_reviews_title: sleeves really long but otherwise amazing
links_reviews_text: Loved this sweater but the sleeves are SUPER long.
It's large and the sleeves are really really long

links_reviews_title: Very cozy sweater on a cold NYC day.
links_reviews_text: Runs very large, especially the sleeves.
I tried this out despite the reviews saying it ran large. The size wasn't that bad for me, but it was too boxy for my taste.
Baggy and huge. This runs large and I felt like I was swimming in it. It was comfortable and warm, but not flattering.

links_reviews_title: Thick comfortable and luxurious sweater with extra long sleeves
links_reviews_text: This sweater is delightful on a cold day when you get to stay inside. The sleeves are almost comically too long and you just don't care because it is flattering and extremely comfortable. Looks too good to be an every day sweater.
Loved this very cozy sweater, even with the extra long sleeves
Cozy and cute! Will definitely rent again!!!
I didn't notice how long the arms are - so it's unwearable as is, maybe sizing down would help, but I doubt it. It's very boxy also, not unflatteringly so, but...
Love this. Sleeves are crazy long but somehow it works as long as you're not working with your hands.

I tried this sweater despite the warnings that the sleeves were super long. I should have heeded the warnings. They were ridiculous, even folded they looked crazy. The sweater itself was not comfortable, I needed a long sleeve shirt underneath. Would not recommend for petites or anyone who is sensitive to itchy material.

It's a cute sweater, and I LOVE oversized sweaters, but this was so big I rolled the sleeves 2 times. Each roll was about 3 inches thick. It was massive. Size down for cute oversized look, size down again for more fitted
It's loose fitting and a great layer. I wore it to coffee with a friend and to a concert - it's versatile! I just might be keeping this one.
Didn't even wear it. It was huge on me.

I loved the color of this sweater- a lovely warm winter white. It is very warm and has a lot of fabric- definitely a cuddle sweater- the sleeves are wide and long. 4 stars instead of 5 because it is scratchy- you'll need to wear a long sleeved shirt underneath- I wore a camisole and was itchy all night. If it had been softer, I might have bought it!

This sweater runs large and looks much better on than on the hanger. I rolled up the very long sleeves even though I have long arms and it still looked super cute. It’s somewhat cropped, but unless I raised my arms high, still covered my tummy.

links_reviews_title: Loved the sweater, but the sleeves failed me.
links_reviews_text: Loved the overall fit of the sweater, but sadly the bell sleeves made it hard to do normal daily activities. They got on the way and were too long...and I have long arms.

Wore this for Thanksgiving with a pair of jeans and knee high boots. Paired it with a cheetah belt and it was perfect! True to size fit, had that oversized look, but was a bit shorter so it paired perfect with a belt accent!
It runs huge! I tried an XL, then an L, now going for a M
Wore this multiple times and debated buying! It definitely is an oversized boxy fit and I sized down to an xs. It was heavier than I anticipated, but perfect for cold weather.

links_reviews_title: Much slouchier than it looks in photos!
links_reviews_text: Sleeves were pretty long on me and definitely an oversize fit but it's a cute, casual slouchy look
Didn't wear. Too big.

links_reviews_title: Can't wait to rent it again

links_reviews_text: I loved renting this coat. I wore it in New York and on vacation in northern California. It was perfect for late winter/early spring weather, as it's not too heavy. It fit true to size with a shirt or sweater underneath—size up if you want to wear more layers. Like some reviews mention, the right lapel doesn't really stay down well, but didn't bother me too much.

links_reviews_title: Fall color and feel, good length
links_reviews_text: Wore this in the 30-50° weather and was comfortable. Material is not soft but not matted. Would recommend as an easy coat.
I was worried it looked a little worn but I think it's the style. Looks great with black, cream, and camel colors! Versatile, wore out for dinner, to work, and every day.

links_reviews_title: Warm, but not for frigid weather
links_reviews_text: Versatile and surprisingly easy to toss on over casual or work day clothes. Wore it for work and weekend and felt put together. Nice orangey red.
I love the color. It's fairly warm for a quick walk outside during the winter. A bit bulky and larger fit. A nice coat to add some color. I felt confident wearing this.

The coat is loosely fitted but not boxy. Soft material with leather collar detailing. It makes any outfit look good especially a cropped turtle neck from DVF and plaid skirt by CARRA. Perfect coat for the low 50s.

links_reviews_title: Wore the shit out of this coat
links_reviews_text: Loved this coat! Pretty warm and loved the oversized feel that allowed enough room to wear a sweater. Tons of compliments and the perfect color for the holidays

links_reviews_title: Cozy coat! Easy to wear over sweaters.
links_reviews_text: The fit was sort of boxy and not as fitted as I would have liked but it was comfortable!

links_reviews_title: Beware the lapel that won't lay down.
links_reviews_text: Pretty rusty red, very orange hue. Would be great for a redhead. Not great for me. The fabric was ok. Not too itchy. But the lapel wouldn't lay flat. Had to send back.

links_reviews_title: Super cozy, perfect shade of autumn in a coat!
links_reviews_text: Love this coat! Can dress up or down. Leather under the collar is such a beautiful touch. Will definitely want to keep it around for all of fall since it's the perfect autumnal coat. I can't wait to wear with more pieces! Only downside is that it's not the warmest material but if you add a thick sweater you'll be fine

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous coat for a mild winter day!
links_reviews_text: This coat is perfect for maybe 50 degrees or so. It is so cute and fit so well. I am usually between S/M and the Small was perfect.

links_reviews_title: Color and texture of this coat is cute
links_reviews_text: Not for petite people! I have a large bust so I got the medium, but I was drowning it it. If you are borderline petite or have short arms, it might be okay to size down. There is some stretch to it so its probably forgiving.

links_reviews_title: Jacket is a beautiful color and fabric!
links_reviews_text: Not super warm so if its cold out i would reccomend a scarf!

links_reviews_title: Pretty color; note the single button
links_reviews_text: Got compliments on the color. Good quality construction. The leather under the collar was a nice touch. I liked the coat but it was a little too big for me. I should have gotten the Med. And for this weight of coat and my climate (Chicago), more than one button would have been useful.

links_reviews_title: Beautiful shade or red and warmer than expected!
links_reviews_text: This coat is lovely and is warmer than I expected.
This is a great jacket!!! Would totally recommend to anyone for cold but not freezing weather.

links_reviews_title: Such a cute color, very warm.
links_reviews_text: It was a perfect length for me, went with dresses and casual jeans. I'm glad I ordered a size up from what I normally wear because it does run slightly small in the arms.
Ordered a medium which was good w/wearing bulky sweaters underneath; could have easily gone with a size Small. You can dress up/dress down...

links_reviews_title: Wore it to an engagement party!
links_reviews_text: Fits true to size, really beautiful color and warmer than I thought!
Great jacket, really comfortable. I found it to be much more rust/adobe colored than the red it appears in photos.
FIt well and was comfortable...Not terribly warm.
Fit is not flattering for me. Didn't wear for my event. Perhaps if I sized down.
Wore this on a work trip to Charlotte (around 50 degrees). Fabric was kind of worn and the jacket is def been used a lot but the color was beautiful.

For some reason this looked more red to me. I got for holiday season but returned immediately bc it is not red at all. More thanksgiving hues. Maybe will rent again later. Nice fabric, new with tags, good weight and fit. Just not right for holiday intentions.

links_reviews_title: This coat is actually nice and toasty. Super stylish for everyday and events.
links_reviews_text: Really easy to layer sweaters, blazers etc underneath and surprisingly warm for not being wool.
This was a great sweater jacket for work! Will rent again!

links_reviews_title: Amazing Color- Matches more outfits than expected
links_reviews_text: I ended up holding onto this coat for over 2 weeks! It is very warm and is such a beautiful color that matched with more outfits that I expected. I love the belt that runs across the back, it's a nice detail that adds a little bit of flare. Wish they made this in more colors! I also found that the Medium was the perfect size to be able to layer without feeling restricted!
If I lived in a cold weather place, I'd but it

links_reviews_title: cute coat and able to wear for work and everyday
links_reviews_text: Fit great and great length
Great color and fit. Not too warm not for a cold day

links_reviews_title: Beautiful quality, really soft, great color. Runs big tho.
links_reviews_text: I'm a 12/14 and the medium was still kind of loose.
oversized overcoat - the color is much more brown in reality.
Rented XL, which was recommended. Gave it a baggy fit. Should've ordered my usual size (L).

Super cute coat that is a fantastic Fall color. Perfect for throwing over a dress or pants and a top. Received many compliments. I'm usually a size Medium, but ordered a Small based on other reviews and the Small was perfect.
This jacket was gorgeous! I'm so sad it was too big, I would definitely recommend sizing down

links_reviews_title: This is a fantastic option for fall. Cozy, stylish and warm.
links_reviews_text: Great fit. Allows for a suit and/or sweater underneath without feeling tight.
I'm obsessed with this jacket and loveeee the color it's sooo comfy! Warm except that it only have the one button so you can't bundle yourself in from cold. Otherwise definitely renting again!

Really soft and cute coat. The color is really nice. Normally a large fits me because of my larger bust and broader shoulders, but this is a little bit loose on me. I think if I sized it down, it would be a little on the snug side.

Shoulders are super big and it is very short. Maybe a size smaller would have looked better? I actually liked this top. My only real complaint is that the inside feels synthetic and I was hoping for more of a cozy sweatshirt feel - it is quarantine season after all and comfort is king! It was nice to mix it up though.

I wore this for work so I layered it over a body suit. It shows quite a bit of underboob if you lift your arms, but is super cute for a concert with a bustier and some high waisted jeans! Fabric is light, shoulders are structured. I recommend pairing this top with an updo!

links_reviews_title: The ugliest thing I've ever seen
links_reviews_text: See photos-- enough said

links_reviews_title: I don't know how I could ever return this
links_reviews_text: SO COOL. Loved wearing this as a matching set with the track pants. The top has some really cool details in the sleeves and the fabric quality feels so good. Such a cool look!
I loved this top! I would suggest a very high waist jean with it! The fit is very cropped and the neck is a little tight but I loved the sleeves. Pyer moss is iconic! Xo Kel
I was so excited to wear this it's super cute a bit more cropped then I was expecting maybe because of my bust area so had to wear a shirt under while at work

This top def makes a statement! I rented it because I love this designer and have personally met him. I initially wore the top to work with a black camisole underneath since it's a crop top. However, after work I took off the camisole and paired the top with leather pants for a trendy chic and casual look. The whole look was a hit. I would rent it again, but next time with the matching sweatpants.
This is what RTR is all about. Wearing some hip outfit from some hot designer that even if I could afford, would be sold out! Loved wearing this outfit!!!
This Pyer Moss sweater/pull over was so comfy and cute. Loved the cut and crop. Overall it fit a bit small on me. Side note: Goes great with a bold red lip.

I wish I had noticed how big the "cape" sleeves are before renting but oh well. This is a unique piece with huge sleeves. I had rented to matching pants but this was a totally different look/ fabric. A light sweatshirt fabric and cropped at a short length which I liked, but I couldn't get into the huge sleeves.

I didn't realize what these sleeves were like when I ordered but I love it! They give a plain shirt a lil somethin extra. It's definitely cropped, I wore on a cold day with a turtleneck underneath, which was a good choice. If I didn't have the shirt underneath, there would definitely be a little midriff showing.

links_reviews_title: This is such a great piece I love the fit and details in the top.
links_reviews_text: The quality of this top everything.
Normally it's not my color but I loved this coat! Looks chick and expensive. Not for cold weather, rather 55-60 degrees max

Wanted to wear this trench a lot but returned it right away. It's ridiculously huge. I know it's the style, but it's not for me. Looked like a sack. I did like it thrown over my shoulders like in the photo.

links_reviews_title: What a stylish trench to take on my work trip to Portugal & Zurich in spring. Made me feel polished
links_reviews_text: Nice long loose fit with a flattering belted waist. This was a great choice for my April trip to Cascais & Lisbon, Portugal along with Zurich. It did wrinkle a little when packed, but the wrinkles did smooth out as I wore it. The buttons are a bit loose, so I wish they were reinforced. I would love to purchase, but it is quite expensive, so I am glad it was available to rent!
Clean cut but also very thin perfect for spring

links_reviews_title: Gorgeous coat but way too big
links_reviews_text: I really should have ordered this coat in a 4/6. If you're petite like I am this might not be the coat for you. Would work much better on taller ladies

links_reviews_title: I wore it 2 days in a row and loving it the 2 day better. This will make and bring your look togethe
links_reviews_text: it looks exactly like the picture, rent it.

I loved wearing this trench coat! I loved the big metal buttons and the fabric it's made of. It's the perfect camel color, super on trend too! It's not lined but has perfectly finished seams throughout. I though it would be thicker, thus better for colder weather, but it's not, it's very lightweight. I wanted to wear it layered over a sweater but found the sleeves to be waaaay to narrow to fit anything other that a shirt underneath. That was not great but hey! I had a blast wearing it and it looked super cool!

links_reviews_title: I love it so much I'm renting it for a while
links_reviews_text: It's perfect

This is a cool coat, but I didn't expect it to be so thin and light weight. In the picture I tried to show the material and how there's no lining. I was hoping to score a great coat for a winter trip to Paris and there's no way this could keep me warm there. Maybe better for spring or fall.

This coat runs small which is ideal for me because usually a 6 would be enormous but it fit perfectly ! Gorgeous coat. Hangs effortlessly and looks expensive but came wrinkled and one cuff was loose which just looks sloppy. Yikes

links_reviews_title: Perfect for a nice event when it's not so cold out
links_reviews_text: Perfect for a Los Angeles fall night as it is not thick. It is very light weight.

It's a great, light-weight, unlined trench. Perfect for days when you want a coat, but it's still kind of warm out. I have small shoulders and it fit really well. Like other reviewers noted, it does wrinkly easily.
Also, short length for sleeves and too much fabric in the body and too little in the arms.
Gorgeous coat, but quite long and runs a bit large.

This was just fine, but not great. The buttons on the sleeves are really heavy and pull the tabs down, which I think would be annoying while wearing. Fabrication didn't feel great, although I did like that it was unlined for this season. Sending back for something more exciting.
And it was perfect. It's ultra chic and was Totally weather resistant
The color is not your typical trench. The lining is what really elevated the product but for how much it costs the buttons are super flimsy. Great addition to any outfit to complete a chic look.
Really wish there was a liner. The coat is very thin. I would say appropriate for mid 60s to low 70s. Not sufficient for a Bay Area morning or evening without a warmer under layer.

links_reviews_title: Nice lightweight jacket. Wrinkles very easily. Not lines.
links_reviews_text: Very stylish, long
I don't want to give this back, I am so in love with the fit and look of this coat
No lining, not much to it. Not that impressive.

Confused about why this is such an expensive coat. Wanted to love it but did not wear because it just wasn't what I needed. No lining, not enough weight to hang nicely, and not water repellent? So really just a long topcoat or blazer or something. Not terribly useful for windy Minnesota. Well, I had to try it.
This is a nice coat- the fit is good, the material is substantial but not too thick (great for say, 40-60 degree weather), but I wish it had more than the single button.

Was really surprised this coat retails for over 1,000! One of the buttons fell off. I got caught in the rain with it and it really isn't a good rain coat. That said it looks just like the picture and wears well. Overall a nice coat
This is a great trench and a great option for RTR due to the exorbitant retail price. It's not a grand nice
I absolutely loved this coat and so did my husband. My only call out is that it runs very large. It also did not come with the belt and that made it very unshaply
Very nice, but I never know what to say when a piece doesn't excite me. It didn't.
Fit like a sack, fabric felt cheap, didn't wear

links_reviews_title: Much lighter than it appears - no heavier than a trench coat
links_reviews_text: The sleeves were very tight and I thought it would be a heavier winter coat. It's a beautiful coat, but no heavier than a trench coat.
Everything about this coat screams FAB!

links_reviews_title: Nice style but too long for someone who's 5'3"
links_reviews_text: Nice looking and the sleeves and chest fit too well. I am 5'3" and it fell a couple inches above my ankles, making it look like a bathrobe on me. It's a lightweight coat - no lining.

links_reviews_title: Nice alternative to the classic trench.
links_reviews_text: Used it over my Valentine’s Day dress.

links_reviews_title: This is a great coat. Lightweight which made it drape and hang nicely. It was very flattering.
links_reviews_text: I wore it open and it was the perfect topper to a skirt and bodysuit combo. I also tried it with the belt tied and it was great for waist definition. Loved wearing it. In fact, if it was a little less expensive I would consider purchasing it. One thing to note, it is very lightweight so not ideal if you’re in true cold-weather.

links_reviews_title: Wore this to sub out my normal work coat!
links_reviews_text: Super well made! Defintely full length coat if you're a short person like me.
Love the coat but a bit too thin for a DC winter
Great to wear at work and going out with friends! Highly recommend!

links_reviews_title: No event. This was for everyday use
links_reviews_text: This is a very thin coat that does not feel very well made.
This jacket is made of a canvas/ duck cloth type material that wrinkles easily and does not provide any warmth, it is very thin. It's more of a trench coat type product.
Not really for tall people, though. On me was high waisted and sleeves were 3/4. Great looking coat for shorter people. Fabric is light-weight and beautiful.

links_reviews_title: Too thin, too large, strange fit
links_reviews_text: I could not wear this. The fabric is too thin, it would not be thick enough to be called a coat, maybe raincoat? But it's not waterproof. Very strange cut.

The fabric and covered button sleeve detailing make this top look rich. The back is completely open so you will need to wear a camisole underneath. The length is definitely on the shorter side. I wore it during Valentine's week and it was perfect!

Loved this velvet top for a belated Valentine's Day celebration with my fiancé! Didn't get any photos of the back but it was so sexy especially with a bra with fun details. Definitely cropped fit on me and I'm short so just be aware of that.

Was very comfortable and soft. Loved the fit and the rich burgundy color. The back is very open so I wore a tank top underneath during the day and then changed into a bra top for date night. Love that it can be dressed up or down. It is cropped but worked fine with higher rise jeans. I almost bought it and will probably rent again.

Definitely should have gotten a small, but I was able to make it work by tying it tighter. Super cute top with high-waisted jeans. Got a lot of compliments on the color! Super versatile and great during the winter months.

links_reviews_title: Luxe fabric & detailing! Great for statement necklace
links_reviews_text: I love the thick, luxe velvet fabric. The cuffs are also big and beautiful with eight velvet buttons on each side. It feels very expensive. I did have to think about how to style this item though because it's a bit cropped and the back is open. It's held together but one hook at the neckline and a tie at the bottom. I easily overcame those challenges with a simple black cami and a cute high-waisted skirt. I am wearing it to the office but this could work for a more formal occasion or a night out. Totally worth renting!

links_reviews_title: LOVED, but it was a little short even for high waisted.

links_reviews_text: I sized up and maybe made it too voluminous... but lovely wine red color & velvety texture & something to dress up or down in holiday season.
Super cute got lots of compliments
Cute with high waisted leggings, back is super open but looks cute with lacy cami!
I sized up. So glad I did! Great velvet and gorg maroon. Careful! The top hook can come undone! It did on me twice while dancing at a concert :/

I love velvet so much that I was considering buying this shirt ... until I wore it for the day. The fabric is beautiful and comfortable. The problem is the clasp at the back. The back of the shirt is held closed by a small clasp at the nape of the neck and a tie at the bottom. The rest is open. The clasp is not stable AT ALL. If I reached down to do anything, it would come undone and the entire shirt back would open. Not functional unfortunately!

links_reviews_title: The color and the fit is so versatile and flattering!! I also love the velvet!
links_reviews_text: Great for day to night and can dress up or down. Very versatile, flattering and feminine!
I loved this top and was very tempted to buy it. Unique material and love the bow in the back. I wore a black tank top underneath. Looks great with high-waisted jeans.

links_reviews_title: I got a ton of compliments on this shirt. It fit well, and the beautiful red velvet was stunning.
links_reviews_text: This shirt is a deep red velvet. It ties in the back, and is open, so I wore it with a tank top. It is also a little short.

links_reviews_title: Loved the style but way too big

links_reviews_text: The top was sexier than I thought. Better for a night out than work. I wore with a black tank underneath.

links_reviews_title: Super cute and pretty color for Valentine's Day- loved the back detail.
links_reviews_text: Little short but good with high rise pants

links_reviews_title: A little big but work great for me
links_reviews_text: The shirt was great, I loved it. It ran slightly big, but as I already prefer loose tops it worked perfectly for me.

Could not figure out how to wear this. It's velvet and dark which says winter to me, but the entire back is open. I tried it with a lace bra but it looked strange. It's beautiful fabric but kind of wish it was just closed in the back.
Didnt have good bra for this

I thought I should size up on this one but I was wrong ... the waist was so large that I couldn't properly tie it in the back. It's a gorgeous shirt though ... nice velvet with pretty button detail on the cuffs. Might try again in a S.

I rented this for the holiday season wasn't sure if I would wear it causally to a Christmas social gathering or what but it's super cute. The sleeve around the wrist area is a little big and I wish the ties in the back weren't so thick but super cute over all. Works well with jeans and booties or slacks with heels.
Pretty color, good quality but not my style

I loved this top and will likely rent again - though I did not realize that the back is completely open when I rented. I had originally thought I'd wear it to work but instead wore it to the World Series parade on a fall day - it was perfect for cooler weather. The velvet kept me warm, but the open back kept it a bit cool. Definitely not a summer top, but great for fall!
love how it ties in the back. The back is open but I was able to wear a tank top underneath.
I thought it was great and I might rent again for a holiday party. I wore a camisole underneath because the shirt is semi-backless

links_reviews_title: Loved the red velvet, challenged by the back
links_reviews_text: The red velvet is gorgeous on this top, and I really loved the way it looked from the front. The back is almost completely open though so it would not be appropriate for certain settings. It was a challenge to style -- a tank top or bralette didn't look great from the back so I went sans bra, which may not work for larger chests. Also note that it closer to a crop top, so you may have extra tummy exposure when you lift your arms.

links_reviews_title: Perfect for A fall anniversary dinner
links_reviews_text: I wore a cami under for a little more modesty with the open back at a 40th anniversary dinner. It was perfect, beautiful fall color just very short if you happen to have a long torso so keep in mind. Bow on the back and sleeves with buttons are beautiful details.

Rented this for an audition. Loved the colour and feel of the fabric! The sleeves were long enough for me and the buttons along the cuff were a great detail. Only thing would be: I don't have a very long torso and this still sat right at my belly button. A bit more like a crop than most would be comfortable with, especially with the open back. A high-waist pant is a must and even then, lifting my arms it creeped up. Would rent again.
Lovely velvet shirt with a beautiful open back & tie and detailed sleeves
Sleeves were a little long but I could roll them underneath. The back is open which I didn’t read it I wore a bodysuit. It was cute.

links_reviews_title: Didn't get to wear it - sleeves were too long.
links_reviews_text: The sleeves were too long for my arms (I'm petite, 4'10") and unfortunately the back is open. I could've worn a tank top under it, but because of the arm length, I decided to return it unworn.
Didn't realize it was backless- My bad, The crop was just a bit too short for me -otherwise cute!
Relaxed beach shirt is helping me hold on to fall! Fabric is great cut for that easy draping/oversized look. So comfy and flowy. I'm buying it.
Loooove this shirt. I wore it Friday Sat and Sunday ;) so comfy and flowy
I loved this top so much I bought it and have worn it every chance I get! It's comfortable and so cute. I wore a medium to make sure the fit was slightly oversized and loved it.

Really liked the rich shabori colors. The shirt fit nicely with food button placement for a good v next. The fabric was slightly rough but it helped it keep shape nicely. Wore for a weekend day outfit with black jeans.
Print has much more blue and much less white. Sleeve is perfect to keep sun off shoulders. Relaxes, easy travel piece.
I loved this shirt! Nice oversized fit (but not too big), looked great partially tucked into jeans.
It fit large but was really comfortable and breathable...perfect for hot weather
Wore a bunch with shorts for weekends at the beach and in CA. Comfortable, light, airy, almost wrinkle free. An easy wear. Slightly large so would consider sizing down.
Wish it was as tie dye as the picture. The front was almost solid blue but the back looked like the picture. Still cute!
I really liked this shirt! I took my usual size, but it's an oversized, boxy fit so you may want to size down. I wore it tied at the waist with jean shorts.
Love the loose fit with tight jeans, denim shorts, white jeans. Loved it! The color is much darker than picture. Much more blue / navy.

links_reviews_title: Loved it for work! Because it was a bit large, I used it as a Front Tie Shirt!
links_reviews_text: Lovely color, great shirt and very soft!

links_reviews_title: Loved this top, got so many compliments. Pairs perfectly with white denim.
links_reviews_text: Fits perfectly, I prob could of used a M since I am between M and L but I wanted it flowy.
This had more blue and less white in the pattern than the picture shows. It is a lightweight fabric and good for hot weather.
This top has ample room everywhere but the waist/hips. Size up, if you are able.
The pattern and colors are very cute but size down! The shirt is somewhat stiff and boxy fit.
A loose fit shirt so hard to say if its "true to size" or not, but the baggy look is nice. It is also very comfortable and fun without drawing too much attention.

links_reviews_title: Interesting, got compliments, liked wearing it
links_reviews_text: Oversized, but glad I got my usual L. Fun tie dyed plaid situation with an airy fabric. Interesting, got compliments, liked wearing it.

Pleasantly surprised with this one Thought it would be massive like the typical "over sized" sweater jacket for the season but it wasn't I was THRILLED! So cozy so warm I'd buy if it wasn't so expensive Also the colors were even better in person. Not muted like I thought they'd be. Vibrant lavender magenta and purple Arms were good length I have long arms Great zipper sturdy large
Warm coat, good for high 40s temps.

This jacket is different than my typical style but I was so intrigued by pictures and wanted to try it. There's no question that the jacket is super comfortable and unique... but it was enough out of my comfort zone style-wise that I only wore it one day before returning it.

links_reviews_title: Soft, gorgeous, incredible, I love it.
links_reviews_text: I had to get a size 40, which is big, and it's already oversized, but even though I'm swimming in it, I'm still going to keep this another month. Paired with a lightweight puffer, this is pretty warm, and very comfortable on its own if the weather's around 50 degrees. Compliments every time I leave the house.

I am obsessed with this coat and it kills me that I can't purchase it. It is very very oversized, so definitely order true to size. I got it in a size larger than I usually wear and I was swimming in it. Didn't mind, cause that's the look. Comfy, cozy, edgy, on trend. Rent this.
Did not read as luxe as I would've wanted

links_reviews_title: So comfortable and stand out for travel.
links_reviews_text: Like wearing a teddy bear pillow. Great print that was almost a neutral. Standout pieces like these are why I am an Unlimited member.

links_reviews_title: So comfy and warm --- and cute!
links_reviews_text: Got so many compliments. Wore quite a few times.

links_reviews_title: I love this jacket! It's so cute and really warm.
links_reviews_text: I've gotten so many compliments in this jacket. It makes any boring outfit pop, it's cozy and warm and I like how oversized it is. I love the colors as well.
Love the design. Just felt so fun and was warm too for the fall in Michigan.
I am so in love with this jacket - i wish i had 700 dollars to buy it - i love it SOOO much
Wore this multiple times. Loved it. By the third wear it started to be a little itchy but it was really faint.
This is a fun and unique sweater. The arms were a bit long.
This was a great every day sweater. Lightweight enough to wear indoors without feeling over heated. Goes with everything but denim worked best.
Absolutely love this sweater! It fit TTS, provided just the right warmth, and looked cute on!

Great sweater for the winter. Colors are nice and varied. Wore with jeans but could be dressed up a bit. I have a long torso/tall so I found it a bit short in length with the small size; same for the arms, so maybe medium would have been better for my taller size 6 frame. Would definitely reorder.
Really pretty pattern and the fabric isn't itchy! I really enjoyed this sweater!
Comfortable, easy, don't need to wear it again. The color is really pretty though

This sweater is cute and has a lot of colors in it when you look close. It runs a tad short but not cropped. It's good to have another shirt under if you're like me and don't want people to have a peek at your tummy when you reach up. But overall I loved it!
Orange with purple running through it and a different pattern on back make for a fun everyday sweater.
Rented for everyday work wear and paired it with the TIBI pants and loved the look!

links_reviews_title: I love this sweater! Very cozy!

links_reviews_text: A nice soft sweater with so many colors it would match anything. Loved it
Adored the fall colors, the way it fit. The only thing I didn't notice until after I bought it was the way the neck falls down a little bit. Still it fit the bill for me to buy. Wasn't expensive.
I was surprised by the look and feel of this sweater. It's flattering and softer than I expected. I'm considering buying it because I think it's a great fall and winter sweater that I'd wear a ton.
Beautiful sweater for the fall. It's not too lightweight and not to heavy. The colors are beautiful and warm. The neck it's a TAD itchy but worth it!

links_reviews_title: Didn't love the pattern or color combination
links_reviews_text: The fit was boxy
Beautiful sweater, warm and cozy without being too thick. Wore it to work with a winter-white skirt and also on a ski trip. Would rent again next winter.
Shoulders are a bit wider than mine and kinda boxy but the colors are fantastic. Cut is not super feminine.
Looks exactly like the pictures and got lots of compliments on the color combinations

links_reviews_title: Cute, but too lightweight for my taste
links_reviews_text: From the photos, this looked like a chunky knit sweater, which I was looking forward to wearing with jeans and boots, as pictured. It was much more lightweight than I expected.

links_reviews_title: Loved it so much I bought it!
links_reviews_text: I almost didn't rent this because it was a lower retail value piece, and I think one of the best things about RTR is getting to wear all of these fabulous & expensive clothes you wouldn't normally buy on your own. With that being said, I finally caved because I live in Boston, winter is cold, and there are only so many sweaters you can rent- you're bound to rent them all eventually, lol. With that being said, this thing is WAY prettier in person than it is online.... gorgeous hints of deep wine, bright yellow... my description isn't great, but trust me the colors are STUNNING, and the fit is gorgeous- hides the extra winter pounds, while still flattering your curves & not making you look like you're wearing a potato sack. Rent it, and then buy it.
Great for a casual work day outfit. Chic without being too warm!
it fit perfectly!

Cute sweater. I love the unique colors (orange / yellow) and the softness of the piece. I wore this to work and out to dinner on a very chilly day and it kept me very warm without the scratchy wool feeling.

This sweater was thin and a bit short on my long torso - but the design had a sliming effect which I quite liked and I loved the mock turtleneck! I only wore it once because it was a bit small all around for me, but I do recommend!

links_reviews_title: just tried on not worn yet
links_reviews_text: Perfect fit
Soft, colorful, versatile.

This sweater is great! I've gotten a ton of compliments on it. It's soft and cozy, but the cut keeps it from feeling too bulky, which is a problem I have with chunky sweaters. The colors are great, a medium orange with subtle lavender, and the two tone front and back is a great subtle detail. I ended up buying it because I loved it so much!

links_reviews_title: Pretty colors and texture, and great cropped fit
links_reviews_text: Positives: great cropped shape is on trend, the pattern and colors are perfect! Challenges: the fabric isn't very soft and in fact is a little scratchy. 100% acrylic can go either way--soft or scratchy. This is scratchy.
Fits true to size. It was a decent sweater but nothing extra special.
Super cute, casual Fall sweater for work or the weekend!
Lots of compliments on this. Excellent for everyday.
This sweater was very flattering--not an oversized slouchy fit by any means. Looked great with flares and a fedora for fall.
A little boxy and shorter than you'd expect. Overall a cute sweater, but not one I would rent again or consider purchasing.
Very light, easy to rollup the sleeves. Perfect for Autumn.
Loved this. Warm and cozy, detailing makes it look more expensive than it is. Would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Wore this out on a date night. This is probably the most comfortable jumpsuit ever.
links_reviews_text: It fit perfectly. It is stretchy and very flattering. I would rent this again in a heartbeat. I wanted to buy it!
Bought this! Literally obsessed. So comfy and flattering!

I loved wearing this jumpsuit. I don't know if I have the best body to wear a jumpsuit like this. I feel like it probably would look better on someone more hourglass than me, but I felt cute in it anyway and the waiter at the restaurant was flirting with me and gave me free bread pudding. So wear this jumpsuit whether you have the perfect body for it or not! You may get free dessert!
The material is super stretchy and comfy! I will absolutely be purchasing this one :)
True to size, maybe a little uncomfortable length for a taller person but it wasn't too bad. Tons of compliments and I felt great. Renting again this weekend!

links_reviews_title: It is meant to be ankle length!
links_reviews_text: Overall I got a lot of compliments and felt sexy. Sitting down would have been uncomfortable because I'm 37 and my stomach isn't as tight as it once was so you could see side rolls. I almost didn't wear it because of this but did because it was a music concert and knew I'd be standing most of the night. The regular length hit me funny cause I'm petite and it's meant a to be an ankle length pant. I had to roll it to look ok. Needs a chunky necklace to break up all that denim.
Obsessed. Buying. Done. Sold. I need nothing else in my life. Fit is perfection. Stretch is perfection. It's perfection.
I LOVED this jumpsuit. It made by booty look great. I felt so confident and ready to party. I do plan to wear it again soon for a different occasion. Def a great stand out piece!

links_reviews_title: Cute but too short on me
links_reviews_text: This is very cute but the length was weird not short enough to be cropped on me and looked like floods. I didn't wear it out and honestly may have been a bit self conscious if I did if you weren't standing straight up it made me feel like I had side boob.
Wore for outside birthday party. Ended up wearing nude cami underneath. It was "cute" but nothing I would buy or wear again my 17 yr old daughter loved it

links_reviews_title: Stretchy thick denim made my bootie pop. A bit conscious about the cutouts showing love handles
Hands down my best rental in the history of ever
links_reviews_text: Rent this now! It is amazing. People stopped me everywhere and asked me where I got it. Had I had more use, and the cost been slightly lower, I would have bought it in a heartbeat. I am very long waisted so it's hard to find jumpsuits that fit and this one was great. It was tight in the chest though so I could not wear a bra

links_reviews_title: Couldn't let this one go before I got a chance to wear it
links_reviews_text: I rented multiple options for my anniversary party and ended up going with a different outfit. This jumpsuit is SO cute and I couldn't send it back without wearing so I wore it with sneakers on a day date beach trip with my husband. I don't think it was the most flattering on me, I have a "boy waist", not a super defined waistline at all. But I still got compliments from randoms and was super comfortable, as others have mentioned there's plenty of stretch. This would be amazing on someone with more defined curves.

This is totally out of my comfort zone but I loved it! I found that it was pretty form fitting but it was really stretchy denim so it wasn't uncomfortable! It was easy to get on and off and I felt really sexy in it. Felt true to size and looked great with vans

I got a lot of compliments on this number! If you get the right size it's so cute. I sized up based on reviews and it for great. It's a little tough to go to the bathroom though so make sure you have someone to help you!

Wow! Super cute jumper. Believe me when I say I NEVER wear jumpers because of my short stature and curvy figure, I can never seem to find the perfect jumper. This one is by far the cutest, most comfortable and stylish one! So many compliments. No complaints. Made my waist look small and my booty look big (: would rent again.

links_reviews_title: Love it and want to buy
links_reviews_text: This was so cute and stretch is perfect all around! Kept it for weeks and totally wish I could buy it!
So fun to wear, got a lot of compliments! I will say that it was almost too small on me though. Maybe the large would have been slightly more roomy...

Talk about a great fit with nice stretch! This denim jumpsuit surprised me. Sometimes fit is an issue but not with this one. The side cutouts will highlight your waistline so if this isn't your most flattering part, don't rent this. Other than that, it's amazing!
Hits you in all the right places!

The fabric is super stretchy so it's comfortable and easy to wear. I went no bra but I think you could wear one with it. The only thing is the torso was almost too long for me in size small and I have a very average size torso. But it was so fun to wear and I got tons of compliments.

links_reviews_title: It was hard to send this one back!
links_reviews_text: This is one of the best jumpsuits I've ever worn. It is flattering and so comfortable. I received a ton of compliments.
Flattering, comfortable, and fun to wear!

LOVE LOVE LOVE. I'm a sucker for denim with some stretch! This one piece fit like a glove. I was worried it would hug me too tight and my skin would pop out the sides lol but it cut in the perfect spot. Definitely will rent this again this summer!

This jumpsuit is everything. I got so many compliments and would have definitely bought it if it weren't so expensive. It's super comfortable as well. I did need to roll up the pants since they fell at a very weird spot when they were unrolled but honestly I liked the look of them rolled even better!
Runs small (I'm a 26 pants and the small fits snug but wearable). This is a must rent!!! I'm so in love! Cut outs show quite a bit of skin but super forgiving!
This jumpsuit is perfect for a spring weekend in the city. Very tight but stretchy so you can skip the bra!

Loved this jumpsuit - was the perfect/easy outfit for a bachelorette in Austin. Threw it on and paired with earrings and a heel and it looked effortless and so flattering. I found that the cut outs hit just above my hip and wasn't too low (which i was worried about). So fun!!

links_reviews_title: So fun and different!! Felt like a trendy farmer
links_reviews_text: Surprisingly really comfy jumpsuit that had a lot of stretch! Got tons of compliments.. so different and such a fun spring look. If you're in between sizes I would go up in size

This jumpsuit was a joy to wear that I got it again. It's really comfortable and flattering. It's stretchy and since it's cotton based it's breathable and good for summer. Length was perfect for being 5"3
Cute! I feel like shoulda been a tad shorter on me?! I liked it! Mine came with tags. I am a size 4 in most everything and 5'4 if that's helpful.

I could not love this jumpsuit more. It's super cute and so flattering. I got a ton of compliments and felt like a million bucks. Glad I went on the 3X1 website to see more pics of it bc there I found out the the XS was a 23-24 and small was 25-26. Got the small and it was perfect.

links_reviews_title: I am going to buy it!
links_reviews_text: Stretch material so gives you room.

links_reviews_title: Did not wear. Did not love the style on me
links_reviews_text: cut-outs not flattering on me. maybe 1 size up would have been better

links_reviews_title: day date wore with converse, loved it!
links_reviews_text: Fit was fitted and was the right length for my height.

links_reviews_title: Super cute, but inexplicably not for me.
links_reviews_text: Y'all, I wanted to love this. Like...so much. But I put it on and giggled. I felt like I was dressing up as an edgy version of myself. It was super comfortable, great stretch, and overall awesome. But just not my personal style...until I get edgier. A girl can dream.

links_reviews_title: I liked this so much I stalked it online until it went on sale and bought it for myself!
links_reviews_text: I got compliments in this so that always helps, but I liked it instantly anyhow due to the heavy-weight denim and stretch which make your bum look great, plus the uniqueness. You don't have to worry about love handles because the cutouts sit higher where the indention in your waist would be and not where love handles sit, but of course, if you have rolls higher up this wouldn't be the right outfit. It looks good with heels or flats, and is a good mix of sexy, stylish, and comfortable all in one. I weigh 140 lbs and am 5'6". It was fitted, but if you want it looser go a size up.
If you carry weight on your stomach and waist like I do, this is not the jumper for you! Wanted to love it, but will on work on someone with a flat stomach and small waist
This is cute! This jump suit has well placed cut outs and stretchy material making it easy to move in even after eating a huge Korean meal. Feels very current and fashionable. Worn with high heels.

links_reviews_title: I love this jumpsuit SO much. I wish I could buy it, but it's pretty expensive. It looked amazing!
links_reviews_text: I'm 5'8' with a little pouch of a belly and was worried it might not be flattering on me, but I loved it! I would wear it again anytime! Highly recommend. I got SO many compliments!

The fur on the inside made this jacket super warm and I was thankful for that! I really enjoyed wearing it and will rent again next winter. It's definitely been "well loved" but I didn't mind. Just beware it's not in mint condition. Still nice though!

links_reviews_title: Great for winter in the city
links_reviews_text: The fur keeps this jacket very warm. Cute and unique add to any outfit

links_reviews_title: New York City was the perfect place to rock this number!
links_reviews_text: The jacket was not just cute but it was WARM! didnt have to risk frost bite to look good.

This jacket is one of my favorite things I've ever worn. It is comfortable, warm, versatile, and absolutely fabulous. I've held onto it for a couple of months, and I get tons of complements every time I wear it.

links_reviews_title: Sleeves are long and jacket is too short.
links_reviews_text: I found the proportions of this jacket a bit odd. As you can see from the photo, the sleeves are long and disproportionate to the crop of the jacket. I do have a short torso so I can only imagine how crop this would be on someone with an average/long torso. I normally do not zip up bomber jackets like this but it was extremely cold and I needed the extra warmth. Did receive a few compliments.

I rented this beautiful jacket for an event and ended up holding onto it for months. I wore it everywhere from dropping my kid off at school to dinner and even over a cocktail dress. I love it and will definitely be renting it again!
One of my fave rentals. Wish I could afford it! Really great to travel with, warm but not too warm. So versatile.

links_reviews_title: Super warm!! The pink is beautiful.
links_reviews_text: This was a fun jacket to wear while winter turned to spring. The pink fur was really soft and a beautiful hue. Other than that, the jacket was pretty basic.
This was everything. I wish the fur was slightly more luxurious than stuffed animal for the retail cost. But it was super cute. Not cute than glam.

links_reviews_title: LOVED! So fun with the pink fur.
links_reviews_text: Fit nicely. The leather is really great. Paired it for a party and at work. It smelled a little weird when I got it, but not the jackets fault.

links_reviews_title: Unique colors on the jacket. Cute style and very warm.
links_reviews_text: The fur trim was faux, which I was not expecting. The inside is also lined with the pink fur, which was a nice and warm touch especially having worn it out in the middle of February. The colors are really cute and different from most styles. I did expect the overall quality to be slightly higher than what I received but I truly cannot complain.

I love this jacket! The blue and pink are so pretty. It's also surprisingly warm because of the "fur" lining. I would say it's comfortable for as low as 40 degree weather. The leather is very soft. The quilting, the zippers, all the details, make it an amazing jacket. I felt like a rockstar! The reason for four instead of five stars is it fit perfectly in the shoulders, arms, and waist. However, it was too tight in the chest if I tried to zip it up. I worry that if I went up to a medium, it would be too bulky and lose. Keeping it unzipped avoided this issue. Next time I try a jacket by this designer, I will try a medium though to see. If the jacket had fit better in the chest, I probably would have purchased it. I loved it that much!

links_reviews_title: I loved it, kept me warm and stylish
links_reviews_text: It's edgy and cute and the pink fluffy collar stands out. I wore it during the day and also for date night. Will rent again. Got lots of compliments.

links_reviews_title: One of my all time favorites
links_reviews_text: Such a great coat! I really enjoyed this one. Soft faux fur, nice leather, all beautiful. Fits true to size, maybe a little larger. Highly recommended!
Loved it. Lots of compliments.
This is a unique leather jacket that gets so many compliments! It is fully lined inside; if you are looking to layer you may want to size up. It's a great length for petites!
Such a fun, standout jacket. I received many compliments. I typically wear a small or medium and sized up to a medium and it fit perfectly
Love this jacket! Super warm and soft! Brightened up the weekend!

Gorgeous! The baby pink faux fur collar is EVERYTHING. I actually got a lot of compliments from random guy strangers, more in a "hey, that's really cool" way rather than in a flirty way, which was lovely. Wore it for fall transition and it was toasty warm!
Loved this rental! The leather is super soft and the colors are fun.

This jacket was beautiful, warm, and unique. It was turning heads! Perfect for a cool, spring weekend because the colors scream spring and the materials are super thick. The sleeves were a tad long but I'm very petite so I'm used to it. The fur was in perfect condition even though I was a bit worried due to some past reviews I read. I adored this jacket.

links_reviews_title: I would have never bought this on my own! Perfect for a fun week in NYC.
links_reviews_text: The pink fur wasn't the most pink/ clean. It smelled of leather cleaner when I got it but I hung it to air out and sprayed it with perfume so it was fine. I wore it almost every day in NYC! It's lined on the inside with pink fur so it was super warm!

Amazing luxe leather with a fun twist. Got compliments on this coat from literally everyone I saw. Wore this out on a Friday night and over work out clothes to brunch. This jacket is lined with faux fur and very warm.

links_reviews_title: I got so many compliments on this jacket!
links_reviews_text: The fit was super comfortable and it was super warm- wore it for a 60* day, and it was perfect.
Great color and fun collar. Inside was soft and comfy. Only issue is a bit short. Wore with pink jeans and sneakers.

links_reviews_title: 2nd time renting & would rent again, again, & again!
links_reviews_text: The best quality, fit & leather on the most remarkable trendy jacket! Pink & blue for the win! The jacket has a little weight to it so it's perfect for a fall or chilly spring day. Sleeves are nice & long which is a luxury for us tall girls! A must rent!
I feel fabulous in this coat it is comfortable and warm really high quality. 5.7 and 140 lbs small fit great. Size up if your wearing anything bulky underneath.
Very warm! It's lined with the faux fur, Great quality

Well, this is a beautifully constructed piece. It's very warm as it is lined with that pink fur seen at the collar. I mean very warm, I mean it's thirty degrees outside but you want to rock that leather jacket warm. That and the fur cuff around the neck made it a poor choice for the early spring temps of the south, and it was a little bulky for me but it fit great. How did you wear it? Let me know @dressupbee!

Loving this jacket, but it's a little tricky for 30 degree temperatures. It's fluffy, lined on the inside and warm. However, it's cropped so lower back is exposed. Also, they collar makes wearing a scarf tricky, but the jacket is pretty open in the front
